response.answer_text: There are 8 universities in New Zealand. They are all good universities. New Zealand universities are ranked in the top 3% in the world New Zealand offers high-quality university education and is a welcoming and safe study destination. more reasons to study in New Zealand 1. New Zealand offers a world-class education. All eight universities are ranked within the top 3% in the world. New Zealand universities were ranked in the top 50 universities in the world in 22 different subjects, and in the top 100 in 39 (out of a possible 46) subjects. 2. New Zealand’s universities have a rigorous quality assurance system which ensures the integrity of a degree from a New Zealand university. 3. New Zealand graduates experience good outcomes – they learn critical thinking skills, have high employment levels, and are well regarded by employers. 4. New Zealand qualifications are widely recognised internationally through the Lisbon Qualification Recognition Convention 5. New Zealand is a safe, welcoming and tolerant country 6. Fees for international PhD students are set at the same rates as domestic students 7. More than 26,000 international students are choosing to study at a New Zealand university 8. New Zealand has a Pastoral Care Code of Practice for international students to ensure their safety and well-being 9. International students rate New Zealand highly as a study destination 10. 93% of international students chose to study in New Zealand because of the reputation of our universities It depends largely on what you want to study. for example, if you want to study Politics - you’d go to Victoria University in Wellington - because that is the capital, where Parliament is - so where the strongest Department of Politics is.
